sections.title: Decide With Confidence
sections.subtitle: Blend intuition and analysis to choose the best financial path

sections.title: Decisions Define Your Financial Life
sections.content: Every savings deposit, investment choice, and purchase is a decision with ripple effects. Clear decision-making reduces anxiety and accelerates progress toward goals.

points.title: Clarify the Choice
points.description: State the decision in one sentence, including the stakes and timeline.

points.title: Gather Data
points.description: Collect relevant numbers, expert perspectives, and personal impact details.

points.title: Evaluate Options
points.description: Compare pros, cons, risks, and alignment with values for each route.

points.title: Commit & Review
points.description: Choose, execute, and set a date to evaluate results and learn.

sections.title: Values First
sections.content: If a decision conflicts with your core values, the financial return won't feel like success.

sections.title: Guard Against Decision Fatigue
sections.content: Too many choices in a short time lead to poor judgment. Batch routine money tasks on a schedule, and leave high-stakes decisions for when you are rested. Create default rules—like automatic transfers or spending limits—to avoid constant deliberation.

sections.title: Decision Drill
steps: Identify a current financial decision you feel stuck on.
Use the framework to map the decision in writing—choice, data, options, commitment.
Note how each option aligns with your top three personal values.
Set an implementation date and a follow-up review period to capture lessons.

sections.title: Pre-Defining Rules
sections.content: Create policies like 'Any purchase over $500 gets a 48-hour cooling-off period' to protect future you from in-the-moment decisions.
